title: Epic: Unified Effect + SQL Migration
description:
Migrate to @effect/sql + idiomatic Effect patterns. Combines Epic 2 (Effect patterns) with Schema Refactor.

## Goals
- Replace raw better-sqlite3 with @effect/sql
- Eliminate Effect.runPromise escapes
- Add proper resource management (acquireRelease)
- Domain models with Model.Class
- Quarantine table for corrupted data
- Structured logging

## Constraints
- App not live (can go offline, change schema freely)
- No external DB consumers
- ~50 writes/sec peak
- Fail fast + quarantine corrupted data
- Model.Class for DB entities only
- Backup restore acceptable

## Estimated Effort
1.5-2 days

## Reference
See REFACTOR_PLAN_V2.md for full details

title: Phase 0: Browser Resource Management
Phase 9: Update AI Service
description:
Use domain models, eliminate runPromise escapes.

## Tasks
- Import Phone schema from @repo/scraper-domain
- Delete duplicate schemas (NormalizedDataSchema, CameraSchema, etc.)
- Keep Vercel AI SDK (@ai-sdk/google) - don't switch
- Wrap AI calls in Effect.tryPromise
- Return typed Effect, not Promise

## Pattern
```typescript
const adaptScrapedData = (rawData: Record<string, unknown>) =>
  Effect.tryPromise({
    try: () => generateObject({
      model: google('gemini-2.0-flash'),
      schema: PhoneSchema,  // From @repo/scraper-domain
      prompt: buildPrompt(rawData),
    }),
    catch: (e) => new AiError({ cause: e }),
  }).pipe(
    Effect.map(result => result.object),
    Effect.retry(Schedule.exponential('1 second').pipe(
      Schedule.compose(Schedule.recurs(3))
    ))
  );
```

## Verification
- AI normalization works end-to-end
- No duplicate schema definitions
- npm run check-types passes

title: Phase 10: Update Scrape Service

- Use Effect.acquireRelease for page lifecycle
- Stay in Effect context throughout

## Before/After
```typescript
// Before
const html = await Effect.runPromise(htmlCache.getRawHtml(slug));
const browser = await Effect.runPromise(browserService.createBrowser());

// After
const html = yield* htmlCache.getRawHtml(slug);
const browser = yield* Effect.scoped(withBrowser);
```

## Key Changes
- scrape() returns Effect.Effect, not Promise
- scrapeFast() returns Effect.Effect, not Promise
- All internal calls use yield*, not await + runPromise
- Page lifecycle managed with acquireRelease

```sql
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS quarantine (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
  slug TEXT NOT NULL,
  source_table TEXT NOT NULL,
  data TEXT NOT NULL,
  error TEXT NOT NULL,
  quarantined_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (unixepoch())
);
CREATE INDEX idx_quarantine_slug ON quarantine(slug);
CREATE INDEX idx_quarantine_source ON quarantine(source_table);
```

## Error Handling Pattern
```typescript
const getPhone = (slug: string) => sql<PhoneRow>`
  SELECT * FROM phone_data WHERE slug = ${slug}
`.pipe(
  Effect.flatMap(rows => rows[0] 
    ? Schema.decode(Phone)(rows[0])
    : Effect.succeed(null)
  ),
  Effect.catchTag('ParseError', (e) =>
    quarantine(slug, 'phone_data', rows[0], e.message).pipe(
      Effect.as(null)
    )
  )
);
```

title: Phase 8: Data Migration (Pipe to JSON)
description:
Convert pipe-delimited strings to JSON arrays.

## Tasks
- Create idempotent migration script
- Add pre-check: count rows needing migration
- Add post-check: count valid JSON rows
- Backup DB before running
- Run migration
- Verify no data loss

## Migration Logic
```typescript
const needsMigration = (value: string) => {
  if (!value) return false;
  try { JSON.parse(value); return false; }  // Already JSON
  catch { return value.includes('|'); }      // Pipe-delimited
};

const migrate = (value: string) => 
  JSON.stringify(value.split('|').filter(Boolean));
```

## Fields to Migrate
- aliases, images, materials, colors
- displayFeatures, cpuCores, sim
- cameraFeatures, others
